intro: Hieracium pseudogriphodes, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. It produces yellow flowers with a distinctive central disk and ray florets, and its leaves are narrow and hairy. Hieracium pseudogriphodes is often found in temperate climates and is sometimes considered an invasive species in certain regions.
